DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen International Classification of Disease for Oncology, Third Edition Anatomic Site Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The ICD-O-3 code that represents the anatomic site where biospecimens were collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Microscopic Findings Domain Biospecimen International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, Third Edition Anatomic Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microscopic findings._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms._Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microscopic findings.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microscopic findings.

Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms.:Named locations of or within the body.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.longName: International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, Third Edition
Concepts.definition: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms.
Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 2553336 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.
